title: About the Architect
text: Senior Data Analyst & BI Lead Bridging the gap between Reporting & Science.

title: About the Architect
text:
The Professional Profile
I am a BI Strategy Lead with over 12 years of experience architecting data solutions.
My expertise lies in the “Full Stack” of decision making: 1. Engineering: Building reliable data pipelines and governance models (SQL/BigQuery). 2. Intelligence: Designing executive dashboards that drive action (Tableau/Power BI). 3. Science: Applying statistical rigor to business ambiguity (Python/Inference).

The Philosophy
I founded this “Lab” to document the intersection of Business Strategy and Computational Logic.
In my view, the role of a data professional is not just to report what happened, but to scientifically determine why it happened and what to do next.

title: Architecting Data Governance
text: In high-variance environments, sensor data arrives in massive, unstructured streams. The lack of governance led to a “Data Swamp” where query costs were spiraling.

title: Architecting Data Governance
text: In high-variance environments, sensor data arrives in massive, unstructured streams. The lack of governance led to a “Data Swamp” where query costs were spiraling.

title: Architecting Data Governance
text:
The Architecture
To solve this, I implemented a tiered lineage strategy.






flowchart LR
  A[qmd] --> B(Knitr)
  A[qmd] --> C(Jupyter)
  B(Knitr) --> D[md]
  C(Jupyter) --> D[md]
  D[md] --> E(pandoc)
  E(pandoc) --> F(HTML)
  E(pandoc) --> G(PDF)
  E(pandoc) --> H(Word)
  E(pandoc) --> I{and more}




Figure 1: How Quarto orchestrates rendering of documents: start with a qmd file, use the Knitr or Jupyter engine to perform the computations and convert it to an md file, then use Pandoc to convert to various file formats including HTML, PDF, and Word.
